alert.note: Alert for Burt; Cedar; Cuming; Dodge; Thurston; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 10:41AM CST until January 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of west central Iowa and east central and northeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.

area.areaDesc: Burt; Cedar; Cuming; Dodge; Thurston; Wayne
